revised_title: Laminar Premixed Flame Extinction Limits: Combined Effects of Stretch and Upstream Heat Loss
tldr: This study investigates the extinction limits of laminar premixed flames, focusing on the combined effects of strain and upstream heat loss in the twin-flame unburnt-to-unburnt opposed flow configuration. The research demonstrates the significance of these factors in controlling properties such as extinction limits and the completeness of combustion within the flame. The findings contribute to the understanding of flame extinguishment and the development of flame inhibitors and suppressants.
